events.name: SG SQL User Group Meetup - Aug 2015
events.description: In August 2015, we have two more volunteers for the UG event. Agenda:  6:30 pm to 7pm - Arrival/ Registration and Networking. 7pm to 7:45pm - 1st session 15 minute break and networking session. Can be longer if 1st session finishes earlier.  8pm to 9:30pm - 2nd session After 9:30pm, adjourned to Lau Pasat for supper and drinks (each person pay for yourself). TOPIC 1: Using PowerShell with SQL Server Business Intelligence PowerShell is a command-line based scripting language used by IT Professionals to automate system administration tasks in Windows platforms. Either via built in cmdlets or an exposed API (SMO), SQL Server professionals can harness the power of PowerShell and leverage it to their organizations' advantage. In this presentation, you will learn some of the ways you can use PowerShell in SQL Server BI Administration in an enterprise environment. You will acquire practical knowledge to start utilizing PowerShell yourself. Finally, you will be inspired on how simple it is to automate those repetitive administration tasks. About Speaker:  Vanessa Rose Castro is a Regulatory Reports Engineer at ING Bank N.V., Singapore. On her daily job she uses Microsoft SQL Server to deliver Business Intelligence to ING branches across South East Asia. You can find solutions to BI development and administrative problems, as well as book reviews on her space on the internet: http://vaniecastro.com/. TOPIC 2: Transaction Log.The SQL Transaction log is one of the most misunderstood parts of SQL Server in terms of how it works. The presentation would cover the basic terminology, logs architectural and VLF algorithm, a few undocumented commands to scan the log file(s), 3-4 domes to relate things with real time with internal details explanation. Besides these, the presentation would also cover what would be the best way to implement log files considering the number of VLFs.  About speaker:Dharmendra Keshari has strong and in-depth experience in Database Management and its internals. Currently, working as Senior Database Administrator in one of the best Semi-Government organization in Singapore. He is an avid, regular mentor on social media, helping several enthusiast in solving problems related to Database management. He has completed certification for “Microsoft SQL Server® 2008, Implementation” and “Maintenance & Administering Microsoft SQL Server 2012 Database”
events.location: Microsoft Singapore, One Marina Boulevard, Level 22, Meeting Room

events.name: August Drupal Meetup: Automated Testing
events.description: This coming August, Joe Chin will be presenting about automated testing using Behat.  Note: This session is more suitable for developers, so if you're looking at improving your developer skills and talk shop with other developers about Drupal, come by! For individuals who are just keen to find out more about Drupal or looking to hire a Drupal expert, come by around 7pm for the networking and food first. This is where you can find out more about Drupal.  Agenda: 7pm – 7:45pm: Networking, chit chat, food 7:45 – 8:30pm: Presentation by Joe Chin 8:30 – 9pm: Q&A, developers talk shop, networking For any questions, please feel free to post it in the comments below!  See ya all!

events.name: talk.js
events.description: The next talk.js will be on Tuesday August 18th. Scheduled Talks:  • The Imitation Game: Redux - Jacky Boen • How I build a static site generator with Gulp - Zell Liew Lightning Talks: • N3.js - Bringing reasoning to the Web - João Bentes Location: PayPal SingaporeSuntec Tower 55Temasek Boulevard #09-01Singapore Venue, free drinks and pizza sponsored by PayPal. Remember to bring photo ID to get through building security. Feel free to ask questions in the SingaporeJS gitter room: https://gitter.im/SingaporeJS/discussions See you there!
events.location: PayPal Singapore, Suntec Tower 5, 5 Temasek Boulevard #09-01
